info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:43PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Fulton, southeastern Herkimer and northwestern Montgomery Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 643 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Herkimer, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ilion, Herkimer, Little Falls, Mohawk, Dolgeville, St. Johnsville, Oppenheim, Ingham Mills, Crum Creek, Garlock Corners, Countryman, Charlesworth Corners, North Ilion, Kringsbush, Rasbach Corner, Fink Basin, South Ilion, Mindenville, Kelhi Corners and Davys Corners. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 29A and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern New York.
